intro: Eutaxia neurocalyx subsp. nacta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eutaxia, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
